intro: Achyranthes pilosa, commonly known as hairy knotweed, is a perennial herb native to tropical and subtropical regions. It features upright, branching stems that are often hairy, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers arranged in dense clusters, and its leaves are alternate, ovate to lanceolate in shape. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. The plant is known for its fibrous roots, which can be used in traditional medicine.
